meanings.definition: To spring back after hitting a surface.
meanings.sent1: The ball will bounce off the wall.
meanings.sent2: I like to bounce a basketball on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The rubber band decided to bounce back after being stretched.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm seemed to bounce off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The idea of resilience can be compared to a ball's bounce.

meanings.definition: To move up and down repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The kids love to bounce on the trampoline.
meanings.sent2: The buoy will bounce on the waves.
meanings.sent3: The bunny continued to bounce around the garden.
meanings.sent4: The music made her heart bounce with joy.
meanings.sent5: The bouncing of the ball echoed through the gym.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase or improvement in a situation.
meanings.sent1: The team experienced a bounce in their performance.
meanings.sent2: The stock market saw a bounce in prices.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected good news brought a bounce to their spirits.
meanings.sent4: The sudden bounce in sales caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The bounce in energy was palpable in the room.

meanings.sent1: The security guard will bounce anyone without a pass.
meanings.sent2: The club may bounce guests who do not follow the dress code.
meanings.sent3: The bouncer had to bounce rowdy individuals from the party.
meanings.sent4: The strict policy will bounce unauthorized personnel.
meanings.sent5: The doorman had to bounce troublemakers from the event.

meanings.sent1: The children bounce with joy at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The puppy will bounce around the yard in excitement.
meanings.sent3: The idea seemed to bounce around in his mind.
meanings.sent4: Her heart started to bounce with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The energy in the room seemed to bounce off the walls.
